alert.note: Alert for Calhoun (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 10:36AM EDT until September 11 at 12:45PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT/1230 PM EDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Panhandle Florida, including the following counties, Calhoun and Gulf. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT /1230 PM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 936 AM CDT /1036 AM EDT/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mexico Beach, Wewahitchka, Stonemill Creek, Honeyville, Chipola Cutoff, Chipola Park, Kinard, Overstreet, Broad Branch, Beacon Hill and Saint Joe Beach. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
